properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 7 at 1:19PM EST until January 8 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Arctic Cold Front Will Bring More Snow...

.A cold front will move southeast across the area this evening
followed by another stronger Arctic cold front late tonight. The
Arctic front will bring with it much colder air to the region and
will also result in the development of accumulating lake effect
snow across the area.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6
inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Erie county.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, brief near zero
visibilities in squalls, and an occasional period of moderate
snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning
commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As the Arctic cold front moves through the
area around 3 to 4 AM tomorrow morning, motorists could expect
to see the best chance for squalls and rapidly changing weather
conditions. Be alert when traveling tonight.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and
traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY
